context:
EVTAR is an end-to-end virtual try-on model that enhances accuracy by using reference images, simplifying the inference process and improving garment texture and detail preservation. We propose EVTAR, anEnd-to-End Virtual Try-onmodel with Additional
Reference, that directly fits the target garment onto the person image while
incorporating reference images to enhance try-on accuracy. Most existing
virtual try-on approaches rely on complex inputs such as agnostic person
images,human pose,densepose, orbody keypoints, making them labor-intensive
and impractical for real-world applications. In contrast, EVTAR adopts atwo-stage training strategy, enabling simple inference with only the source
image and the target garment inputs. Our model generates try-on results without
masks,densepose, or segmentation maps. Moreover, EVTAR leverages additional
reference images of different individuals wearing the same clothes to preservegarment textureandfine-grained detailsbetter. This mechanism is analogous to
how humans consider reference models when choosing outfits, thereby simulating
a more realistic and high-quality dressing effect. We enrich the training data
withsupplementary referencesandunpaired person imagesto support these
capabilities. We evaluate EVTAR on two widely used benchmarks and diverse
tasks, and the results consistently validate the effectiveness of our approach. Code is available at:https://github.com/360CVGroup/EVTAR. Model is available at:https://huggingface.co/qihoo360/EVTAR. metadata.title: EVTAR: End-to-End Try on with Additional Unpaired Visual Reference
